headline: Representative Mark Finchem Calls for Arizona to End Participation in the Electronic Registration Information Center (ERIC) Like Louisiana Just Did
author: STATION GOSSIP
sentences: The call to cease participation is taken amid concerns raised by citizens, government watchdog groups, cybersecurity professionals, state elections officials from other states and credible media reports about potentially questionable funding sources that lack arms-lengthen separation from partisan actors who may have access to ERIC network data for political purposes.

After learning of potential vulnerabilities, and the potential for partisan exploitation of the database, which drove close scrutiny of ERIC, it appears that participation may no longer be in the best interest of Arizona voters.

When Arizona joined ERIC, the former Secretary of State did so under the impression that it would be secure and that it would enhance the accuracy of our voter rolls, strengthening Arizona’s election system integrity.

https://www.thegatewaypundit.com/2022/01/breaking-news-louisiana-decides-suspend-use-soros-open-societys-voter-registration-system-eric/
Now future Secretary of State Finchem is calling for Arizona to do the same.

I have serious reservations that it is not.”
We reported a week ago on the ERIC system that is used across the country as a Democrat voter drive system that they claim is used to clean up voter rolls.
Will Arizona join Louisiana and stop using ERIC, the tool the far-left uses for voter registration drives that is disguised as a voter roll clean-up system?
These circumstances undermine voter confidence in the election system, moreover, they ultimately translate into doubts about election integrity.
Arizona Secretary of State candidate Mark Finchem is calling for the state to end its participation with the ERIC voter registration system.
The task of the Secretary of State is to ensure that the data voters have entrusted to the elections officials is secure and well protected.
Unfortunately, it is likely that Arizona won’t get out of using ERIC as long as the current Secretary of State, Katie Hobbs, is in office.
Secretary of State Candidate Mark Finchem calls for Arizona to end participation in the Electronic Registration Information Center (ERIC).
“I support the investigation of any legitimate allegation of voter fraud or possible misuse of our voters’ personal information.
Ending a state’s relationship with ERIC is a step in the right direction.
Americans have had enough of far-left cheating in elections.
